answers.answer: Hi!DDAVP is Desmopressin. This is asynthetic hormone similar to the natural hormone vasopressin that controls urine output. Vasopressin reduces urine output. So in cases where there is increased urine formation as in diabetes insipidus and in cases where urine output needs to be temporarily delayed as in bed wetting, Desmopressin is prescribed. Take care!

question: Can DDAVP be used with vasopressin
title: Paralegal
